name: Algeria
desc: Algeria has domestic drone production and imported the medium-range Seeker II tactical drones from South Africa in 1998. Reports suggest Algeria operates Denel Dynamecs Seeker drones and is interested in obtaining U.A.E.-based Adcom Systems Yabhon United 40 Block 5 drones. Algeria has possibly purchased military drones equipment from Israel, although what exactly was purchased is unknown, however, in 2009 Israel requested export processing permits to supply Algeria with components for drones.[lv] Algeria is reportedly in discussions with China to purchase the Xianglong High Altitude Long Endurance unmanned aerial vehicle and the CH-4 which is capable of carrying two laser-guided missiles and two small guided bombs.
source: Morocco News Tribune: http://morocconewstribune.com/algerian-researchers-manufacture-algerias-first-unmanned-plane/, Institute for National Security Studies: http://inss.web2.moonsite.co.il/uploadimages/SystemFiles/israel-2012.pdf, Defense News: http://www.defensenews.com/article/20131118/DEFREG04/311180014/With-Adcom-Drone-UAE-Makes-Big-Export-Push, Dawn: http://www.dawn.com/news/1017515/british-report-reveals-israels-arms-exports-to-pakistan, Defence Web: http://www.defenceweb.co.za/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=33353:algeria-acquires-chinese-artillery-evaluating-drones&catid=50:Land&Itemid=105, Defence Web: http://www.defenceweb.co.za/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=33927:algeria-evaluating-chinese-ch-4-uav&catid=35:Aerospace

name: Angola
desc: Reports indicate that Angola imported Heron drones from Israel. The company Aeronautics reports selling its Aerostar Tactical Unmanned Air Vehicle System to Angola.
source: Homeland Security Newswire: http://www.homelandsecuritynewswire.com/dr20121019-hezbollah-drone-represents-changing-technological-landscape-for-israel, Global Post: http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/regions/middle-east/israel-and-palestine/121015/israels-drones-unmanned-and-unbound?page=0,1, Aeronautics: http://www.aeronautics-sys.com/aerostar_tactical_uav

name: Argentina
desc: Argentina has domestic drone production.  It is possible that there is cooperation between Israel and Argentina, but reports are unconfirmed.
source: CSM: http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Americas/2011/0420/Spread-of-drone-programs-in-Latin-America-sparks-calls-for-code-of-conduct, ASCOA: http://www.as-coa.org/articles/explainer-drones-latin-america, WorldCrunch: http://www.worldcrunch.com/culture-society/no-man-039-s-air-military-and-police-drones-proliferate-in-latin-america/drones-latin-america-police-crime/c3s14234/#.UtVt_bT7O8E

name: Armenia
desc: Armenia has domestic production of their Krunk drones which is a close reconnaissance drone.  Armenia has also agreed to export their Krunk drones to Denmark.
source: News Am: http://news.am/eng/news/121584.html, Pan Armenian: http://www.panarmenian.net/eng/news/170824/

name: Australia
desc: Australia has domestic drone production and has also imported drones from the United States and Israel. Plans moving forward include purchasing the Northrop Grumman MQ-4C Triton drones.
source: ABC: http://www.abc.net.au/news/2012-06-08/australias-drones-war-in-afghanistan/4058058, Bloomberg: http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2010-07-20/general-atomics-gains-approval-to-sell-predator-drones-to-pakistan-egypt.html, Library of Congress: http://www.uadrones.net/military/research/acrobat/0611.pdf, School of Advanced Military Studies: http://www.hsdl.org/?view&did=697903, NASA: https://www.nasa.gov/centers/dryden/pdf/111761main_UAV_Capabilities_Assessment.pdf, Flight Global: http://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/australian-interest-in-mq-4c-triton-moves-forward-385973/, ABC: http://www.abc.net.au/news/2012-09-04/australia-moves-to-buy-spy-drones/4236544

name: Austria
desc: Austria has domestic drone production. Reported plans include importing more drones, though it is unclear from where and there are recent purchases of Cassidian Tracker mini drones from a U.K. based company.
source: NYT: http://www.nytimes.com/2014/02/17/business/international/competition-fierce-for-sales-of-unarmed-drones.html?_r=0, AP: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/06/04/austria-drones_n_1569352.html, Airbus Defense and Space: http://www.defenceandsecurity-airbusds.com/pl_PL/web/guest/austrian-armed-forces-select-the-tracker-mini-uas, Schiebel: http://www.schiebel.net/Products/Unmanned-Air-Systems/CAMCOPTER-S-100/Introduction.aspx

name: Azerbaijan
desc: Azerbaijan has imported drones from Israel and begun domestic production in partnership with Israeli firms. Shipments of drones from Israel continued through 2013. Reportedly purchased five Heron drones, 5 Searches, and twelve Hermes 450 from Israel.
source: AP: http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/israel-signs-1-6-billion-arms-deal-with-azerbaijan-1.414916, Global Post: http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/regions/europe/121022/drones-violence-along-armenian-azerbaijani-border-could-lead-war, Global Post: http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/regions/middle-east/israel-and-palestine/121015/israels-drones-unmanned-and-unbound?page=0,1, Karabakh: http://www.karabakh.org/news/analysis/azerbaijan-steps-up-national-drones-production/, UPI: http://www.upi.com/Business_News/Security-Industry/2011/10/07/Azeris-get-Israel-Drones-built-under-license/UPI-45671318007974/, UPI: http://www.upi.com/Business_News/Security-Industry/2012/03/20/Russia-to-build-mini-DRONES-drones/UPI-67911332274228/, Israel's Homeland Security Home: http://i-hls.com/2013/06/more-israeli-made-uas-to-azerbaijan/

name: Belarus
desc: Belarus has imported drones from Russia. Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko announced plans to begin production of drones in Turkmenistan and plans to export drones to Vietnam.
source: UPI: http://www.upi.com/Business_News/Security-Industry/2012/03/20/Russia-to-build-mini-DRONES-drones/UPI-67911332274228/, RFE/RL: http://www.rferl.org/content/belarus-turkmenisan-drones/25159726.html, Defense News: http://www.defensenews.com/article/20131106/DEFREG01/311060024, Thanh Nien News: http://www.thanhniennews.com/index/pages/20130517-vietnam-to-buy-unmanned-aerial-vehicles-from-belarus.aspx

name: Belgium
desc: Belgium has domestic production of drones for photogrammetry and terrain mapping and has imported RQ-5 Hunter drones, jointly produced by the US and Israel. Belgium had plans to develop a HALE research drone but the current status of the program is unknown.
source: Trimble: http://www.trimble.com/news/release.aspx?id=040612a, Flight Global: http://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/un-seeks-unmanned-aircraft-for-use-in-dr-congo-381242/, Inter-Commission Working Group: http://www.geometh.ethz.ch/uav_g/proceedings/everaerts

name: Bolvia
desc: Purchased two Ucon System Remoeye-006 drones from South Korea.
source: COHA: http://www.coha.org/coha-report-drones-in-latin-america/, Defense Market Intelligence: http://dmilt.com/index.php?option=com_content&id=6917:bolivia-air-force-receives-skorean-designed-uav&Itemid=58

name: Botswana
desc: There are reports of domestic production but Botswana has also imported drones from Israel. There are reports of requests from Botswana to purchase drones from the United States.
source: Haaretz: http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.567693, WSJ: http://online.wsj.com/news/articles/SB10001424052702304795804579100944028167308

name: Brazil
desc: Brazil has domestic production of small surveillance drones but has also imported Hermes drones from Israel.  Brazil plans joint drone production with Argentina and Israel and a possible partnership with Turkey.
source: ASCOA: http://www.as-coa.org/articles/explainer-drones-latin-america, UPI: http://www.upi.com/Business_News/Security-Industry/2009/08/03/Drones-tested-for-Brazilian-police/UPI-91221249341564/, UPI: http://www.upi.com/Business_News/Security-Industry/2012/04/18/Argentina-plans-more-defense-manufacturing/UPI-47551334785840/, Haaretz: http://www.haaretz.com/print-edition/news/brazil-under-fire-for-spending-350-million-on-israeli-drones-1.265590, CSM: http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Americas/2011/0420/Spread-of-drone-programs-in-Latin-America-sparks-calls-for-code-of-conduct, Global Post: http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/regions/americas/brazil/130104/brazil-commercial-drones-uavs-coming-soon, Today's Zaman: http://www.todayszaman.com/news-324057-turkeys-homemade-corvette-uav-attract-brazils-attention.html, AEL Sistemas: http://www.ael.com.br/ing/ael_sistemas.php

name: Bulgaria
desc: Bulgaria has domestic production of mini-drones and has signed on to be a member of NATO's Airborne Ground Surveillance Program which will give NATO five High Altitude Long Endurance drones by 2017.
source: Northrop Grumman: http://www.northropgrumman.com/Capabilities/NATOAGS/Pages/default.aspx, NATO: http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/topics_48892.htm, Army Recognition: http://www.armyrecognition.com/july_2012_new_army_military_defence_industry_uk/bulgarian_army_would_like_to_create_first_reconnaissance_drone_unit_to_join_ags_nato_program_3107122.html, Euro UVS: http://uvs-international.org/phocadownload/01_5_Presentations_by_UVSI/002_AUVSI_Summer-2001_Overview-of-the-current-uav-situation-with-a-focus-on-Europe.pdf, NATO: http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/topics_48892.htm

name: Burundi
desc: Burundi has drones in the form of military aid from the United States.
source: BBC: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-13946702, AP: http://www.armytimes.com/article/20110626/NEWS/106260308/Pentagon-sending-45M-in-equipment-to-Somalia

name: Canada
desc: Canada produces drones domestically. Drones are also imported from Israel, namely for use in Afghanistan. At one time, Canada was considering importing drones from the United States.
source: Globe and Mail: http://www.theglobeandmail.com/technology/tech-news/canadian-technology-and-the-flight-of-the-drones/article17849259/, Library of Congress: http://www.dtic.mil/cgi-bin/GetTRDoc?AD=ADA521374, CBC News: http://www.cbc.ca/world/story/2009/03/06/cdn-drones.html, Canadian Press: http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/politics/ottawa-considers-high-altitude-drones-for-arctic-surveillance/article4219537/

name: Chile
desc: Chile has domestic production of drones and has imported drones from Israel. There are reports of drone purchases from Iran and reports of Hermes 900 medium sized drones purchased from Israel by the navy.  Armed forces are already operating Hermes 900 drones.
source: ASCOA: http://www.as-coa.org/articles/explainer-drones-latin-america, UPI: http://www.upi.com/Business_News/Security-Industry/2013/04/05/Chile-orders-mini-Drones/UPI-27371365180187/, McClatchy DC:  http://www.mcclatchydc.com/2013/11/04/207398/increasing-drones-usage-in-latin.html, RT: http://rt.com/news/latin-america-drones-unregulated-216/, Flight Global: http://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/chilean-navy-considers-hermes-900-deal-391408/, CSM: http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Americas/2011/0420/Spread-of-drone-programs-in-Latin-America-sparks-calls-for-code-of-conduct

name: China
desc: China has domestic production of armed and unarmed drones, and limited imports from Israel. There are limited imports from Japan, too, and some reports indicate that Germany has provided the engines used in Chinese drones. Another report alleges that Iran gave China access to the RQ-170 drone that went down in China. In August 2006, Japan's Yamaha Motor Company was accused of selling the RMAX helicopter drones to the Beijing Technology Company, which has ties to the Chinese People's Liberation Army (PLA), in violation of Japan's Foreign Exchange and Foreign Trade Control Law. China used surveillance drones, believed to be a Chinese BZK-005, over the Senkaku Islands in late 2013, and has used drones for domestic surveillance. Chinese authorities said in February 2013 that they had considered using a drone to kill a drug dealer in Myanmar who was responsible for the deaths of 13 Chinese soldiers. China also recorded the successful flight of its first stealth combat drone, the "Sharp Sword," in November 2013. China unveiled the CH-4 and Yilong drones equipped with Blue Arrow-7 anti-tank missiles, which have designs similar to that of the U.S. Predator drones equipped with Hellfire missiles. China's drone arsenal has grown large enough to compete with the United States. Reports accuse China of hacking into U.S. drone companies and accessing information needed to ramp up their drone technologies. Unsubstantiated report that China has exported drones to the UAE and Uzbekistan.
source: WSJ: http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052748703374304575622350604500556.html, Popular Science: http://www.popsci.com/technology/article/2012-12/inside-chinas-secret-arsenal, NYT: http://www.nytimes.com/2013/02/21/world/asia/chinese-plan-to-use-drones-highlights-military-advances.html, BBC: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-china-25033155, PopSci: http://www.popsci.com/technology/article/2012-12/inside-chinas-secret-arsenal, Der Spiegel: http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/messengers-of-death-are-drones-creating-a-new-global-arms-race-a-792590-2.html, Library of Congress: http://www.uadrones.net/military/research/acrobat/0611.pdf, NYT: http://www.nytimes.com/2013/02/21/world/asia/chinese-plan-to-use-drones-highlights-military-advances.html, NYT: http://www.nytimes.com/2013/09/21/world/asia/hacking-us-secrets-china-pushes-for-drones.html?_r=1&pagewanted=all&,  BBC: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-china-25033155, US News: http://www.usnews.com/news/articles/2013/03/14/report-chinese-drones-swarms-designed-to-attack-american-aircraft-carriers, Diplomat: http://thediplomat.com/2013/11/the-battle-for-the-senkakus-moves-to-the-skies/, Asia Defense Forum Review: http://apdforum.com/en_GB/article/rmiap/articles/online/features/2013/06/28/china-adds-drones

name: Colombia
desc: Colombia announced the launch of domestic production of a drone program meant to combat drug-trafficking. There are also imports from the United States.  The Washington Post reported that it was not clear from Wikileaks documents whether the drones were flown by U.S. military forces in Colombia or given to the Colombian armed forces as part of a multibillion-dollar military aid program. There have been imports of Hermes drones from Israel and Colombia is considering purchasing another Hermes 900 drones. The country's first drone flight simulator for training operators of drones was successfully produced in 2013.
source: ASCOA: http://www.as-coa.org/articles/explainer-drones-latin-america, In Sight Crime: http://www.insightcrime.org/news-briefs/colombia-producing-drones, UPI: http://www.upi.com/Science_News/Technology/2012/01/23/Colombia-mulls-buying-more-Israeli-Drones/UPI-27271327360725/, Washington Post: http://articles.washingtonpost.com/2011-03-23/world/35261451_1_drones-scaneagle-farc, COHA: http://www.coha.org/latin-america-puts-forward-a-mixed-picture-on-the-use-of-drones-in-the-region/, Al Jazeera: http://www.aljazeera.com/indepth/opinion/2012/11/2012116114514211617.html, Global Post: http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/agencia-efe/130510/colombia-rolls-out-flight-simulator-drones, Dialogo: http://dialogo-americas.com/en_GB/articles/rmisa/features/regional_news/2013/08/01/colombia-drones

name: Croatia
desc: Croatia imported two Hermes 450 drones from Israel in 2007.
source: Military Factory: http://www.militaryfactory.com/aircraft/detail.asp?aircraft_id=824

name: Czech Republic
desc: The Czech Republic has domestic production of drones. Along with 14 other NATO allies, will take part in buying five drones for NATO by 2017.
source: WSJ: http://blogs.wsj.com/emergingeurope/2013/06/12/drones-play-peacetime-role-with-flood-coverage/, Reuters: http://www.reuters.com/article/2012/02/15/us-nato-drones-idUSTRE81E1SD20120215, Paul Springer: https://books.google.com/books?id=b6-FrR21CicC&printsec=frontcover&dq=Springer,+Paul+J.+Military+Robots+and+Drones:+A+Reference+Handbook&hl=en&sa=X&ei=K5qRVNaGJvDisASHhICYCw&ved=0CCYQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q&f=false, NATO: http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/topics_48892.htm

name: Denmark
desc: Drones are produced domestically. Denmark has purchased Puma UAVs from the United States. Two Raven drones have been loaned by the Netherlands for training purposes in 2012. Ten Krunk drones have been exported from Armenia for agronomic research. Military reconnaissance drones are produced domestically with no payload capacity, but the Huggin X1 drones can be linked with a Canadian built (Colt Canada) network platform mounted to a soldier's weapon designed to provide surveillance based upon the direction and angle of the soldier's weapon. Participating in NATO's Airborne Ground Surveillance Program which will give NATO five HALE drones by 2017.
source: Army Recognition: http://www.armyrecognition.com/danish_denmark_military_defence_equipment_uk/sky-watch_huginn_x1_x2_drones_unmanned_aerial_vehicle_technical_data_sheet_specifications_description.html, Flight Global: http://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/denmark-signs-deal-for-handheld-puma-uavs-372950/, Radio Netherlands Worldwide: http://www.rnw.nl/english/bulletin/denmark-borrows-dutch-drones, PanArmenian: http://www.panarmenian.net/eng/news/170824/Armenia_to_export_drones_to_DenmarkArmenian, Defense News: http://www.defensenews.com/article/20130624/DEFFEAT01/306240019/Aim-Fire-Fly-UAV, NATO: http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/topics_48892.htm

name: Ecuador
desc: Ecuador has imported Heron 1 and Searcher-2 drones from Israel and is producing prototypes of domestic drones.
source: Der Spiegel: http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/messengers-of-death-are-drones-creating-a-new-global-arms-race-a-792590-2.html, Institute for National Security Studies: http://inss.web2.moonsite.co.il/uploadimages/SystemFiles/israel-2012.pdf, CSM: http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Americas/2011/0420/Spread-of-drone-programs-in-Latin-America-sparks-calls-for-code-of-conduct, COHA: http://www.coha.org/coha-report-drones-in-latin-america/

name: Egypt
desc: Egypt has imported R4E SkyEye and M324 Scarab tactical drones from the United States and ten ANKA drones from Turkey. General Atomics, a US company, received export licenses to sell an unarmed export version of the Predator to Egypt in 2010. Egypt has also domestically produced twelve ASN-209 drones in cooperation with a Chinese company.
source: Flight Global: http://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/egypt-plans-tactical-uav-modernisation-208913/, JPost: http://www.jpost.com/Middle-East/Egyptians-to-purchase-Turkish-made-drones, Bloomberg: http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2010-07-20/general-atomics-gains-approval-to-sell-predator-drones-to-pakistan-egypt.html, SUAS News: http://www.suasnews.com/2012/05/15804/egypt-nation-produces-uav-in-cooperation-with-china/, Strategy Page: https://www.strategypage.com/htmw/htairfo/20120524.aspx

name: Estonia
desc: Estonia domestically produces UAS Swan drones which are only outfitted with camera technology and have been exported to Georgia. There are reports that Estonia plans to purchase surveillance drones, such as the RQ-4 Global Hawk UAV and RQ-11 Raven, within the next few years. Participating in NATO's Airborne Ground Surveillance Program which will give NATO five HALE drones by 2017.
source: ELI Military Simulations: http://www.eli.ee/products/7/unmanned-aerial-system-swan-ii, MinnPost: http://www.minnpost.com/global-post/2012/10/how-russia-and-georgias-little-war-started-drone-arms-race, Embassy of Estonia: http://estonia.usembassy.gov/sp_102510.html, Defense News: http://www.defensenews.com/article/20140513/DEFREG01/305130032/Ukraine-Crisis-Speeds-E-European-UAV-Efforts, NATO: http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/topics_48892.htm

name: Ethiopia
desc: Ethiopia has claimed to domestically developed and produced drones, and has also imported BlueBird drones from Israel.  The U.S. is operating drone bases out of Ethiopia.
source: Sudan Tribune: http://allafrica.com/stories/201302150091.html, Haaretz: http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/israel-is-world-s-largest-exporter-of-drones-study-finds.premium-1.524771#, Flight Global: http://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/ethiopian-army-to-get-bluebird-uavs-355404/, Washington Post: http://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/us-drones-base-in-ethiopia-is-operational/2011/10/27/gIQAznKwMM_story.html, BBC: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-15488804

name: Finland
desc: Finland has domestic production of drones but has also imported from Israel.
source: BBC: http://www.bbc.com/news/technology-27485418, Defense News: http://www.defensenews.com/article/20120516/DEFREG04/305160004/Israeli-Company-Wins-Finnish-Mini-DRONES-Bid

name: France
desc: France has domestic productionof drones but also imports from Israel and Canada.  Collaboration with Britain; Italy, Switzerland, Sweden, Spain, Greece; and with Germany in producing drones.   Imports from the U.S. include unarmed MQ-9 Reaper drones. France deployed two of the recently purchased unarmed Reaper drones to Niger to support the mission in Mali. France has joined with Germany, Greece, Italy, Netherlands, Poland, and Spain to create a _drone users club" intended to compete with Israeli and U.S. drones markets. Morocco is considering purchasing France's surplus Israeli Drones.
source: Safran Group: http://www.safran-group.com/site-safran-en/press-media/press-releases/2012-785/article/sagem-awarded-new-tactical-drone?12204, Haaretz: http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/france-to-buy-israeli-made-drones-42-years-after-it-banned-weapons-sales-to-israel-1.374991, Reuters:" http://www.reuters.com/article/2013/05/19/us-france-drones-idUSBRE94I04H20130519, UPI: http://www.upi.com/Business_News/Security-Industry/2009/10/21/French-Air-Force-wants-more-drones/UPI-73141256146860/, Huff Post: http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2012/12/03/neuron-europes-first-stealth-drone-test-flight_n_2230316.html, Reuters: http://uk.reuters.com/article/2014/05/19/uk-europe-defence-drones-idUKKBN0DZ0ZQ20140519 and http://www.reuters.com/article/2013/12/19/us-mali-france-drones-idUSBRE9BI0VY20131219, AFP: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/07/15/france-reaper-drones-us_n_3600549.html, Bloomberg: http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2014-07-21/hollande-greeted-by-drones-as-military-deployed-across-sahel.html, USA Today: http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2013/11/19/europe-drones/3640273/, World Tribune: http://www.worldtribune.com/2014/01/20/morocco-said-to-buy-israeli-designed-drones-from-france/

name: Georgia
desc: Georgia has domestic production of drones and imported Hermes 450 and Skylark drones from Israel and Swan drones from Estonia.
source: Rustavi: http://rustavi2.com/news/news_text.php?id_news=45155&pg=1&im=main&ct=0&wth=0, Eurasianet: http://www.eurasianet.org/node/65250, NYT: http://www.nytimes.com/2008/05/27/world/europe/27georgia.html, RIA Novosti: http://en.ria.ru/military_news/20120409/172711721.html, MinnPost: http://www.minnpost.com/global-post/2012/10/how-russia-and-georgias-little-war-started-drone-arms-race

name: Germany
desc: Germany has domestic production of mini-drones and short-range drones. Germany was collaborating with the European aerospace company EADS to develop five Euro Hawk drones, based on the U.S. Global Hawk, but the program was cancelled in 2013. Germany then joined six other EU states to create Medium Altitude Long Endurance drones intended to compete with Israeli and U.S. drone firms. Germany has imported three Heron drones from Israel which were used in Afghanistan. Participating in NATO's Airborne Ground Surveillance Program which will give NATO five HALE drones by 2017.
source: Defense Industry Daily: http://www.defenseindustrydaily.com/euro-hawk-program-cleared-for-takeoff-03051/, EU Observer: http://euobserver.com/defence/122167, Der Spiegel: http://www.spiegel.de/international/germany/the-bundeswehr-s-new-drone-german-air-force-unveils-powerful-spy-plane-a-791419.html, Der Spiegel: http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/messengers-of-death-are-drones-creating-a-new-global-arms-race-a-792590-2.html, LUNA UAV: http://www.emt-penzberg.de/en/produkte/drohnensystem/luna.html, NATO: http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/topics_48892.htm

name: Greece
desc: Greece has domestic production of Medium Altitude Long Endurance drones in conjunction with Sweden, Switzerland, Spain, Italy and France. Sperwer MkII UAVs have been imported from France. Unsubstantiated report that Greece was looking to purchase drones from Israel.
source: CNN: http://www.cnn.com/2012/10/01/opinion/bergen-world-of-drones/, Safran Group: http://www.safran-na.com/spip.php?rubrique61, Armed Forces International: http://www.armedforces-int.com/news/sperwer-mk-ii-uavs-for-french-army.html, Israel's Homeland Security Home: i-hls.com/2014/06/greece-wants-israeli-drones/

name: Hungary
desc: Hungary has domestic production of drones. Hungary has also imported Elbit Skylark drones from Israel.
source: Budapest Times: http://www.budapesttimes.hu/2012/11/12/hungarian-drones-create-a-buzz/, Military Factory: http://www.militaryfactory.com/aircraft/detail.asp?aircraft_id=1044

name: India
desc: India has domestic production of Lakshya, Nishant and Rustom drones. India has also imported Heron, Searcher-II and Harpy Killer UCAV drones from Israel. The Defence Research and Development Organization, an agency of the Republic of India, is continuing development on the AURA drones combat designed drones set for release as late as 2020. Officials announced that they would soon be equipping drones with precision guided munitions. There was a recent request for 49 hand-held mini drones for troops.
source: SIPRI: http://www.sipri.org/yearbook/2003/files/SIPRIYB0312.pdf, TOI: http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/Armed-forces-building-deadly-drone-arsenal-also-want-combat-UAVs/articleshow/18341063.cms, TOI: http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2010-03-26/india/28144019_1_searcher-ii-spy-drones-af-pak-region, Himal: http://old.himalmag.com/himal-feed/54/379-Indias-indigenous-drones.html, The Diplomat: http://thediplomat.com/2013/08/india-eyes-drones-launched-smart-bombs/, DNA: http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report-dna-exclusive-49-drones-to-keep-an-eye-on-china-and-pakistan-borders-1895756, Military Factor: http://www.militaryfactory.com/aircraft/detail.asp?aircraft_id=985

name: Indonesia
desc: Indonesia has imported Searcher-II drones from Israel. Officials announced that the domestically produced Wulung drones will be mass-produced.
source: JPost: http://www.jpost.com/Israel/Indonesia-to-buy-four-Israeli-spy-drones, VOA: http://www.voanews.com/content/indonesia-readies-mass-production-of-drones/1651633.html, Jakarta Globe: http://www.thejakartaglobe.com/archive/dont-worry-about-drones-source-indonesia-defense-ministry-says/496512/, Jakarta Post: http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2012/10/13/indonesia-develops-drone-monitor-border-regions.html

name: Iran
desc: Iran has domestic production of drones.  In August 2010, Iran unveiled the "Karar" drone, which President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad called an "ambassador of death," and which reportedly can carry up to four cruise missiles with a range of over 600 miles. Iranian-made Ababil drones (which function more as cruise missiles) have been used by Hezbollah. According to the Iranian military, there is also domestic production of drones of short-range reconnaissance such as the Yasseer drones and  Shahad-129 drones capable of 1,700 km range carrying up to 8 missiles.  In November 2013, they released Fotros drones with a 2,000 km range. In 2014, officials claimed to have reverse-engineered a RQ-170 U.S. drone that was downed in Iran in 2011.
source: Guardian: http://www.theguardian.com/world/2010/aug/22/mahmoud-ahmadinejad-iran-bomber-drone and http://www.theguardian.com/world/2013/oct/21/iran-russia-us-scaneagle-spy-drone-production-capture, NYT: http://www.nytimes.com/2010/08/23/world/middleeast/23iran.html, YT News: http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4433889,00.html, BBC: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-24993269, Reuters: http://www.reuters.com/article/2013/02/24/us-iran-drones-idUSBRE91N00A20130224, Post: http://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/iran-says-it-downed-us-stealth-drones-pentagon-acknowledges-aircraft-downing/2011/12/04/gIQAyxa8TO_story.html, Press TV: http://www.presstv.com/detail/2013/12/25/341932/iran-builds-new-unmanned-aerial-vehicle/

name: Iraq
desc: Iraq has imported from U.S. and Iraq's navy has purchased U.S. drones to protect the country's oil platforms in the South, from where most of Iraq's oil is shipped. Imported ten ScanEagle drones from U.S. for surveillance against insurgents.
source: Reuters: http://www.reuters.com/article/2012/05/21/us-iraq-energy-idUSBRE84K0H120120521, Bloomberg: http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2013-12-26/u-s-providing-drones-and-missiles-to-aid-iraq-in-terror-fight.html, Department of Defense: http://www.defense.gov/news/newsarticle.aspx?id=121442

name: Israel
exports_to: Algeria, Angola, Australia, Azerbaijan, Botswana, Brazil, Canada, Chile, China, Columbia, Croatia, Ecuador, Ethiopia, Finland, France, Germany, Georgia, Hungary, India, Indonesia, Ivory Coast, Kazakhstan, Mexico, Nigeria, Philippines, Republic of Serbia, Russia, Singapore, South Korea, Spain, Sri Lanka, Taiwan, Thailand, Turkey, Uganda, Ukraine, United Kingdom, United States
desc: Israel has domestic production of drones and imports drone engines from the United Kingdom. Israel is the largest exporter of drones in the world, responsible for 41 percent of all drones exported between 2001 and 2011, according to a database compiled by the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute, though it refuses to release the full list of countries to which it has sold military arms. A partial list of recipients includes the U.S., U.K., Canada, France, Australia, Germany, Spain, Brazil, India, China, Poland, the Netherlands, Azerbaijan, and Nigeria. U.S. consulting firm Frost & Sullivan reported in 2013 that Israel exported nearly $4.6 billion worth of systems between 2005 and 2012.
source: Reuters: http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/12/05/us-israel-drones-idUSTRE7B40XH20111205, Washington Post: http://www.washingtonpost.com/world/national-security/in-gaza-lives-shaped-by-drones/2011/11/30/gIQAjaP6OO_story.htm, Haaretz: http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/1.567696, Salon: http://www.salon.com/2012/05/15/israels_drone_dominance/, WSJ: http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052748703374304575622350604500556.html, Al Jazeera: http://www.aljazeera.com/programmes/peopleandpower/2014/04/201442911431250545.html, Haaretz: http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/israel-is-world-s-largest-exporter-of-drones-study-finds.premium-1.524771#, AP: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/06/05/israel-world-largest-drone-exporter_n_3392034.html

name: Italy
desc: Italy has domestic production of drones. Imports from the U.S. include the unarmed RQ-1B Reaper drones. Reports indicate that the United States planned to arm Italy's MQ-9 Reaper drones in Afghanistan with Hellfire missiles. Italy is also pursuing development of Black MALE.   Italy has joined with France, Germany, Netherlands, Poland and Spain to create a "drone users club" intended to compete with the Israeli and U.S. drone markets.  Italy is to produce Medium Altitude Long Endurance nEUROn drones in conjunction with Sweden, Switzerland, Spain, Greece and France. Participating in NATO's Airborne Ground Surveillance Program which will give NATO five HALE drones by 2017.
source: Defense News: http://www.defensenews.com/article/20131115/DEFREG01/311150026/UAE-Ups-Its-Stake-Drones-maker-Piaggio-Aero, Gizmag: http://www.gizmag.com/hammerhead-uav-italy-flight/29889/, Guardian: http://www.theguardian.com/news/datablog/2012/aug/03/drone-stocks-by-country, NYT: http://www.nytimes.com/2012/05/30/world/europe/us-proposes-arming-6-of-italys-reaper-drones.html, Business Insider: http://www.businessinsider.com/italy-drones-armed-with-us-missiles-2012-5, Aviation Week: http://aviationweek.com/awin/italy-looking-develop-black-male-uav, EU Observer: http://euobserver.com/defence/122167, Huff Post: http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2012/12/03/neuron-europes-first-stealth-drone-test-flight_n_2230316.html, NATO: http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/topics_48892.htm

name: Ivory Coast
desc: The Ivory Coast has imported drones from Israel. They have also sent a request to the U.N. for drones to monitor their border with Liberia.
source: Global Post: http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/regions/middle-east/israel-and-palestine/121015/israels-drones-unmanned-and-unbound?page=0,1, BBC: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-22181553

name: Japan
desc: Japan has domestic production of small helicopter drones. In 2013, Japan planned on purchasing three drones to build up the nation's defense. The U.S. deployed two Global Hawk drones to Japan.
source: Forbes: http://www.forbes.com/sites/alexknapp/2011/11/03/japanese-defense-ministry-develops-spherical-flying-drone/, WSJ: http://blogs.wsj.com/japanrealtime/2013/12/17/japan-to-protect-islands-with-drones-and-amphibious-units/, BBC: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-25411653, Washington Times: http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2014/may/30/us-deploys-advanced-drones-to-japan-to-watch-china/

name: Jordan
desc: Jordan has domestic production of drones and co-production of drones with an Italian company. The Jordan Falcon drones, produced as a result of a joint venture between the King Abdullah II Design and Development Bureau and Jordan Aerospace industries, is a light-class unarmed drones capable of reconnaissance, surveillance, and target designation/tracking.
source: UPI: http://www.upi.com/Business_News/Security-Industry/2009/12/02/Jordan-works-with-Selex-for-drones/UPI-88051259805753/, Military Factory: http://www.militaryfactory.com/aircraft/detail.asp?aircraft_id=904, King Abdullah II Design and Development Bureau: http://www.kaddb.com/SitePage.aspx?PageId=78

name: Kazakhstan
desc: Kazakhstan imported the Orbiter drones from Israel in 2008 and has also reportedly imported ten Irkut drones from Russia. Kazakhstan is in talks with the Israeli companies Elbit and IAI to establish a tactical drones manufacturing facility in the country in 2013. Kazakhstan also signed a deal with Sagem in 2010 to jointly produce drones within Kazakhstan; however this agreement has yet to manifest.
source: Institute for National Security Studies: http://inss.web2.moonsite.co.il/uploadimages/SystemFiles/israel-2012.pdf, Bnews: http://www.bnews.kz/en/news/post/103129/, Security Assistance Monitor: http://securityassistancemonitor.wordpress.com/2013/11/06/with-belarus-venture-turkmenistan-to-become-newest-eurasian-drone-manufacturer/, Safran Group: http://www.sagem.com/spip.php?article713

name: Kenya
desc: Kenya has imported drones from Israeli companies. U.S. gave eight small Raven drones, which Kenya has used to surveil militants and poachers.
source: Global Post: http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/regions/middle-east/israel-and-palestine/121015/israels-drones-unmanned-and-unbound?page=0,1, WSJ: http://online.wsj.com/news/articles/SB10001424052702304795804579100944028167308, WSJ: http://online.wsj.com/news/articles/SB10000872396390444097904577539362229840378, Guardian: http://www.theguardian.com/environment/2014/apr/25/kenya-drones-national-parks-poaching

name: Latvia
desc: Latvia has domestic production of drones manufactured by UAV Factory, which produces the Penguin B, BE & C drones. Participating in NATO's Airborne Ground Surveillance Program which will give NATO five HALE drones by 2017.
source: UAS Yearbook: http://uas.usgs.gov/UAS-Yearbook2010/pdf/P161-195_World-UAS-Reference-Section.pdf, UAV Factory: http://www.uavfactory.com/page/technical-data, NATO: http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/topics_48892.htm

name: Lebanon
desc: Lebanon was given twelve Raven UAV by the United States as part of a military aid package, and will receive drones from France in 2015 as part of a larger military equipment purchase.
source: UPI: http://www.upi.com/Top_News/Special/2009/03/23/Lebanon-gets-Raven-mini-DRONES-from-US/UPI-71721237838143/, Forbes: http://www.forbes.com/pictures/mhl45glli/rq-11-raven/, Reuters: http://www.reuters.com/article/2014/11/05/mideast-crisis-lebanon-france-idUSL6N0SV5V120141105

name: Libya
desc: Libyan Air Force uses drones for aerial surveillance,but it is unclear where they acquired the drones and no reports of domestic production.
source: Libya Herald: http://www.libyaherald.com/2013/03/17/libyan-drones-take-to-skies-for-first-time/#axzz2tnEkXn00, Libyan Embassy: http://english.libyanembassy.org/?p=4283

name: Lithuania
desc: Lithuania contributed over $6.5 million to NATO's Alliance Ground Surveillance (AGS) division developed by NATO, an alliance between 15 nations who will share five Global Hawk RQ-4B drones for high altitude reconnaissance and surveillance.
source: 15min: http://www.15min.lt/en/article/politics/lithuania-to-contribute-4-8-million-euros-to-nato-s-unmanned-aircraft-program-526-220911, NATO: http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/topics_48892.htm

name: Luxembourg
desc: Participating in NATO's Airborne Ground Surveillance Program which will give NATO five HALE drones by 2017.
source: NATO: http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/topics_48892.htm

name: Malaysia
desc: Malaysia has domestic production of drones manufactured by three companies, Composites Technology Research Malaysia (CTRM), Systems Consultancy Sdn Bhd (SCS), and Ikramatic Sdn Bhn, who partnered to form Unmanned Systems Technology Sdn Bhd (UST). UST produces Aludra low altitude long endurance drones and worked with Adcom Systems, a United Arab Emirates company to develop the Yabhon Aludra medium altitude long endurance drone.
source: Star: http://www.thestar.com.my/story/?file=/2007/5/16/nation/17738522, Brahmand: http://www.brahmand.com/news/Malaysia-to-produce-indigenous-DRONES-in-2010/2623/1/11.html, Defence Review Asia: http://www.defencereviewasia.com/articles/195/Asian-region-UAV-capability-on-the-rise

name: Mexico
desc: Mexico has domestic production of drones operating at least 100 and has also imported Hermes 450 drones from Israel.
source: ASCOA: http://www.as-coa.org/articles/explainer-drones-latin-america

name: Morocco
desc: The status of drones in Morocco is uncertain. General Atomics received an export license to sell an unarmed Predator drones to Morocco but it is unclear whether that deal has been completed. Unsubstantiated reports that Morocco purchased three surplus Israeli-made Heron drones from France. Unsubstantiated release from the Royal Moroccan Armed Forces announced its pre-production search and development phase of drones for 2014-2015.
source: Bloomberg: http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2010-07-20/general-atomics-gains-approval-to-sell-predator-drones-to-pakistan-egypt.html, CNN: http://www.cnn.com/2012/10/01/opinion/bergen-world-of-drones/, Israel Defense: http://www.israeldefense.com/?CategoryID=472&ArticleID=2702, Defense Industry Daily: http://www.defenseindustrydaily.com/frances-harfang-sidm-iuav-program-06091/, Royal Moroccan Armed Forces: http://farmorocco.wordpress.com/2014/01/17/industry-first-moroccan-made-uav/

name: Netherlands
desc: The Netherlands has domestic production of drones and imported drones from Israel and possibly from France, owning around 75 drones. They have acquired four MQ-9 Reaper Medium Altitude Long Endurance drones from the United States and  are expected to have full operational capability at the end of 2017. Two Raven drones were loaned to Denmark for training purposes in 2012.
source: Haaretz: http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/israel-is-world-s-largest-exporter-of-drones-study-finds.premium-1.524771#, Dutch News: http://www.dutchnews.nl/news/archives/2013/03/use_of_drone_aircraft_by_polic.php, Aviation Week: http://aviationweek.com/blog/reaper-goes-dutch, Radio Netherlands Worldwide: http://www.rnw.nl/english/bulletin/denmark-borrows-dutch-drones

name: New Zealand
desc: New Zealand domestically produces the AeroHawk drone and has purchased Predator drones from the United States.
source: Bloomberg: http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2010-07-20/general-atomics-gains-approval-to-sell-predator-drones-to-pakistan-egypt.html, Hawkeye UAV: http://www.hawkeyeuav.com/company/about-us.html

name: Nigeria
desc: Nigeria has imported Aerostar drones from Israel. The domestically produced GULMA drone was revealed in 2013. The Nigerian Air Force Institute of Technology (AFIT) produced the GULMA drones that barely meets the Tier II classification flying at a maximum altitude of 10,000 feet, reaching a top speed of 86 knots and possessing an endurance of 5.8 hours.
source: Global Post: http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/regions/middle-east/israel-and-palestine/121015/israels-drones-unmanned-and-unbound?page=0,1, Popular Science: http://www.popsci.com/article/technology/nigeria-shows-its-first-drone, Defence Web: http://www.defenceweb.co.za/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=33115:nigerian-commissions-new-drones&catid=35:Aerospace&Itemid=107

name: Norway
desc: Norway has domestic production of Black Hornet pocket drones by Prox Dynamics and has been asked by the United States to develop the pocket-sized drone for the U.S. Army. Participating in NATO's Airborne Ground Surveillance Program which will give NATO five HALE drones by 2017.
source: Military and Aerospace: http://www.militaryaerospace.com/articles/2013/10/helicopter-micro-uav.html, NATO: http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/topics_48892.htm

name: Pakistan
desc: Pakistan has domestic production of drones, first deployed in 2013 and has imported drones from China and United States.  There has been reported co-production of drones with Italian and Chinese manufacturers in separate projects.  It is unclear whether or not Pakistan's domestic drones are armed or not, as the drones bear resemblance to Chinese armed Rainbow CH-3 drones, however, military officials have claimed that the drones are for surveillance only.
source: NASA: http://www.nasa.gov/centers/dryden/pdf/111761main_UAV_Capabilities_Assessment.pdf, Reuters: http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/04/21/usa-pakistan-drones-idUSN2129161820110421, UPI: http://www.upi.com/Business_News/Security-Industry/2009/08/31/Pakistan-to-make-its-own-drones/UPI-71101251759880/, Global Post: http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/regions/middle-east/israel-and-palestine/121015/israels-drones-unmanned-and-unbound?page=0,1, NYT: http://www.nytimes.com/2013/11/26/world/asia/pakistan-domestic-drones-ready.html, Washington Post: http://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia_pacific/pakistan-unveils-its-own-military-drones-as-protests-continue-against-us-attacks/2013/11/25/fae691cc-5607-11e3-bdbf-097ab2a3dc2b_story.html, Diplomat: http://thediplomat.com/2014/05/pakistan-seeks-chinese-drones/

name: Panama
desc: Panama planned on importing $300 million in drones from the United States and at one time was considering purchasing Heron drones from Israel.
source: JPost: http://www.jpost.com/Israel/After-Brazil-and-El-Salvador-Panama-to-test-Israeli-UAV, Dialogo: http://dialogo-americas.com/en_GB/articles/saii/features/main/2011/06/30/feature-01?change_locale=true

name: Peru
desc: Peru has domestic production of three drone models and has imported five Israeli drones for both military and non-military purposes.
source: ASCOA: http://www.as-coa.org/articles/explainer-drones-latin-america, COHA: http://www.coha.org/coha-report-drones-in-latin-america/

name: Philippines
desc: The Philippines have domestic production of Raptor and Knight Falcon drones and has imported drones from Israel.  Drones have been used for border monitoring. The army is developing a third drone model that will combine the features of the Raptor and Knight Falcon drones.
source: Gulf News: http://gulfnews.com/news/world/philippines/philippines-admits-use-of-drones-against-anti-government-forces-1.1269439, Philippine Star: http://www.philstar.com/headlines/2013/12/20/1270362/troops-used-drones-zamboanga-crisis-ops

name: Poland
desc: Poland has domestic production of drones and imports drones from the US. Poland sought drones from Israel but Israel cancelled Poland's export licenses in 2014, killing any potential sale. In May 2014, the Polish government announced that it would be replacing its aging fighter jets with  armed drones by 2022, the first of which will be acquired in 2016. In November 2014, the Polish government said will begin acquiring reconnaissance drones in 2017 and attack models in 2018-2019 and that talks were underway with U.S. manufacturers, among others. Participating in NATO's Airborne Ground Surveillance Program which will give NATO five HALE drones by 2017.
source: Defense News: http://www.defensenews.com/article/20141104/DEFREG01/311040030, Defense News: http://www.defensenews.com/article/20131211/DEFREG01/312110020/Poland-Seeks-Boost-Drone-Fleet, Defense News: http://www.defensenews.com/article/20140513/DEFREG01/305130032/Ukraine-Crisis-Speeds-E-European-UAV-Efforts, Globes: http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-defense-ministry-nixes-uav-sale-to-poland-1000916180, Haaretz: http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/israel-is-world-s-largest-exporter-of-drones-study-finds.premium-1.524771#, NATO: http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/topics_48892.htm

name: Portugal
desc: Portugal has domestic production of drones.
source: Portugal News Online: http://www.theportugalnews.com/news/portugals-drone-flop-goes-viral/31340#.U1pS0N9qoIU.twitter, UAVISION: http://www.uavision.com/#!about2/c4nz

name: Republic of Serbia
desc: Serbia has domestic production of drones and purchased Israeli Orbiter drones in 2008.
source: Balkan Monitor: http://balkanmonitor.wordpress.com/2010/01/29/uavs-serbian-uav-solution-sparrow/, WikiLeaks: https://wikileaks.org/gifiles/docs/74/743279_israel-serbia-serbia-s-domestically-developed-drone-makes.html

name: Romania
desc: Participating in NATO's Alliance Ground Surveillance program, a consortium of 15 countries that will maintain five Global Hawk high altitude long endurance drones.
source: NATO: http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/topics_48892.htm

name: Russia
desc: Russia has domestic production of drones and plans to invest an additional $9.2 billion in production. In 2009, Russia purchased $150 million on drones from Israel.  Construction of a co-produced mini drone with Vietnam was announced in 2012. Russia is developing its first long range drones capable of conducting ground attack missions, scheduled for deployment by 2017. NBC News reported that Russia is developing a 20 ton attack drones whose prototype could be ready by 2020. Russia will conduct test flights in the UAE of a drone aircraft capable of carrying Namrod air-surface guided missiles.
source: Diplomat: http://thediplomat.com/2014/06/russias-coming-combat-drones/, Ria Novosti: http://en.rian.ru/analysis/20110811/165713287.html, Defense News: http://www.defensenews.com/article/20140513/DEFREG01/305130032/Ukraine-Crisis-Speeds-E-European-UAV-Efforts, Haaretz: http://www.haaretz.com/print-edition/news/russia-in-talks-to-buy-israeli-made-spy-drones-1.2589, UPI: http://www.upi.com/Business_News/Security-Industry/2012/03/20/Russia-to-build-mini-uav-drones/UPI-67911332274228/, NBC: http://www.nbcnews.com/tech/innovation/20-ton-attack-drone-under-development-russia-f8C11351266, Defense Talk: http://www.defencetalk.com/russia-to-test-uae-made-drone-next-year-49815/

name: Singapore
desc: Singapore has domestic production of Skyblade drones and imports Heron, Hermes and Searcher II drones from Israel.
source: JPost: http://www.jpost.com/Defense/Singapore-now-flying-improved-Israeli-drones, Flight Global: http://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/singapore-to-deploy-skyblade-iii-uav-350317/

name: Slovakia
desc: Slovakia has domestic production of drones. Reports that Skylark drones have been imported from Israel lack credibility. Slovakia is participating in NATO's Alliance Ground Surveillance program, a consortium of 15 countries that will maintain five Global Hawk high altitude long endurance drones.
source: ET-Air-UAV: http://www.etair-uav.com/about1.html, NATO: http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/topics_48892.htm, Pravda: http://spravy.pravda.sk/domace/clanok/162527-armada-kupila-bezpilotne-lietadla-snazila-sa-to-tajit/

name: Slovenia
desc: Slovenia has domestic production of drones. Participating in NATO's Alliance Ground Surveillance program, a consortium of 15 countries that will maintain five Global Hawk high altitude long endurance drones.
source: NATO: http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/topics_48892.htm, C-ASTRAL Aerospace: http://c-astral.com/about-us/about-c-astral/

name: South Africa
desc: South Africa has domestic production of drones and exports to Algeria and UAE. South Africa reportedly agreed to help Saudi Arabia develop armed drones in April 2013.
source: Denel Dynamics: http://www.deneldynamics.co.za/index.php/world-class-products, Reuters: http://www.reuters.com/article/2010/09/22/africa-missiles-idUSLDE68L1AM20100922, UPI: http://www.upi.com/Business_News/Security-Industry/2013/04/16/Saudis-turn-to-South-Africa-for-uavs/UPI-20551366129424/

name: South Korea
desc: South Korea has domestic production of drones. Reports of both  imports from Israel and a joint development program with Israel. South Korea is struck a deal witht the United States to import four RQ-4 Block 30 Global Hawk drones that are expected to be delivered between 2017 and 2019.
source: Korea Times: http://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2012/09/113_120065.html, Der Spiegel: http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/messengers-of-death-are-drones-creating-a-new-global-arms-race-a-792590.html, Yonhap News: http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/business/2014/04/11/24/0503000000AEN20140411004800320F.html, Reuters: http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/09/01/us-korea-usa-globalhawk-idUSTRE78005T20110901, SUAS News: http://www.suasnews.com/2013/11/25978/south-korean-global-hawks-set-for-2017-19-delivery/

name: Spain
desc: Spain has domestic production of mini and MALE drones and used Israeli Heron and Searcher drones in Afghanistan.  Spain joined with France, Germany, Greece, Italy, the Netherlands and Poland to create a "drones users club" with the hopes of catching up to United States and Israel's drone capabilities. Spain has worked with Greece, Sweden, Switzerland, Italy and France to develop the Medium Altitude Long Endurance nEUROn drones.
source: Haaretz: http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/israel-is-world-s-largest-exporter-of-drones-study-finds.premium-1.524771#, Der Spiegel: http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/messengers-of-death-are-drones-creating-a-new-global-arms-race-a-792590.html, EU Observer: http://euobserver.com/defence/122167, Huff Post: http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2012/12/03/neuron-europes-first-stealth-drone-test-flight_n_2230316.html, Diplomat in Spain: http://thediplomatinspain.com/en/espana-perdio-dos-drones-en-afganistan-pero-ninguno-acabo-en-manos-de-los-taliban-2/

name: Sri Lanka
desc: Sri Lanka has imported Searcher II and Scout drones from Israel.
source: Defence Review Asia: http://www.defencereviewasia.com/articles/195/Asian-region-UAV-capability-on-the-rise, Der Spiegel: http://www.spiegel.de/international/world/messengers-of-death-are-drones-creating-a-new-global-arms-race-a-792590.html

name: Sweden
desc: Sweden has domestic production of drones. Sweden worked with Greece, Switzerland, Spain, Italy and France to produce the nEUROn Medium Altitude Long Endurance drone. Sweden entered into an agreement with Vietnam to provide drones technology and help in producing drones.
source: Swedish Wire: http://www.swedishwire.com/business/18932-combat-jetmaker-saab-plans-to-build-drones, Huff Post: http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2012/12/03/neuron-europes-first-stealth-drone-test-flight_n_2230316.html, SUAS News: http://www.suasnews.com/2012/11/19783/vietnam-sweden-to-cooperate-in-unmanned-aircraft-manufacturing/

name: Switzerland
desc: Switzerland has domestic production of drones.  Switzerland also produces nEUROn drones in cooperation with Greece, Sweden, Spain, Italy and France. Switzerland is contemplating importing drones from Israel to replace outdated Ranger UAVs developed in conjunction with Israel.
source: Swiss Info: http://www.swissinfo.ch/eng/successful-takeoff-for-swiss-commercial-drones/35863208, UMS Group: http://umsgroup.aero/company/about-us/, Huff Post: http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2012/12/03/neuron-europes-first-stealth-drone-test-flight_n_2230316.html

name: Taiwan
desc: Taiwan has domestic production of drones and is developing drones similar to the Predator MQ-9.
source: Defence Review Asia: http://www.defencereviewasia.com/articles/195/Asian-region-UAV-capability-on-the-rise, Flight Global: http://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/taiwan-looks-to-develop-advanced-unmanned-systems-360628/, Drone Wars UK: http://dronewarsuk.files.wordpress.com/2014/01/israel-and-the-drone-wars.pdf

name: Tanzania
desc: There are allegations that Tanzania has imported from Israel. Discussed anti-poaching program with the United States that would give Tanzania drones to track and patrol endangered species.
source: Global Post: http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/regions/middle-east/israel-and-palestine/121015/israels-drones-unmanned-and-unbound?page=0,1, Defence Web: http://www.defenceweb.co.za/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=32029:tanzania-considering-us-proposal-to-use-drones-in-anti-poaching-ops&catid=87:border-security&Itemid=188

name: Thailand
desc: Thailand imports SeaFox submersible mining drones from Germany, Searcher and Aerostar drones Israel, Ravens from the United States, three drones from Malaysia, and Silvertone Flamingo drones from Australia. Thailand's Royal Thai Air Force Commander in Chief announced plans to request funds to continue development of a drone developed domestically.
source: UPI: http://www.upi.com/Business_News/Security-Industry/2011/12/15/Thailand-signs-up-for-drone-mine-hunters/UPI-97621323948540/#ixzz1yMM1wXqy, Defence Review Asia: http://www.defencereviewasia.com/articles/195/Asian-region-UAV-capability-on-the-rise, Thai Intel Diplomacy News: http://aseandefense.wordpress.com/2013/07/02/thailand-to-develop-advance-drones-to-be-aseans-drone-hub/, Flight Global: http://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/royal-thai-air-force-orders-aerostar-uavs-351460/

name: Tunisia
desc: Tunisia has domestic production of drones by Tunisia Aero Technologies Industries S.A.
source: Tunisia Aero Tech: http://tati-uas.com/uav-projects/

name: Turkey
desc: Turkey has domestic production of ANKA drones and has imported Heron and Aerostar drones from Israel. The Turkish government signed a contract to acquire 10 medium altitude long endurance drones from Turkish Aerospace Industries to be delivered in 2016 and are capable of being armed.
source: Today's Zaman: http://www.todayszaman.com/news-305039-mass-production-of-turkeys-first-national-uav-imminent.html, JPost: http://www.jpost.com/Middle-East/Egyptians-to-purchase-Turkish-made-drones, Turkish Weekly: http://www.turkishweekly.net/news/161521/turkey-prepares-to-launch-first-domestically-made-drones.html, Institute for National Security Studies: http://inss.web2.moonsite.co.il/uploadimages/SystemFiles/israel-2012.pdf

name: United Arab Emirates
desc: The U.A.E. has domestic production of short-range and MALE drones and imports unarmed RQ-1 Predator XP drones from the U.S.  Reportedly in talks to export Adcom Systems Yabhon United 40 Block 5 drones to Algeria and Russia. In 2009, reportedly engaged in talks with Israel for the export of drone supply components. Unsubstantiated report that the UAE has imported armed drones from China.
source: Flight Global: http://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/dubai-09-uae-designed-uav-almost-ready-to-fly-334988/, Defense Industry Daily: http://www.defenseindustrydaily.com/uae-tie-up-inroduces-the-rq-1-predator-xp-06787/, North Africa Post: http://northafricapost.com/4577-algeria-reinforcing-aerial-defense.html, Defense News: http://www.defensenews.com/article/20131209/DEFREG04/312090019/Russia-Conduct-Test-Flights-Emirati-Drones, Dawn: http://www.dawn.com/news/1017515/british-report-reveals-israels-arms-exports-to-pakistan, Asia Defense Forum Review: http://apdforum.com/en_GB/article/rmiap/articles/online/features/2013/06/28/china-adds-drones

name: Uganda
desc: Uganda has four Raven drones as part of military aid package from the United States to combat al Shabaab in Somalia.Uganda also imported two Orbiter 2 drones from Israel.
source: BBC: http://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-13946702, Haaretz: http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/israel-is-world-s-largest-exporter-of-drones-study-finds.premium-1.524771#, Flight Global: http://www.flightglobal.com/news/articles/ugandan-army-to-acquire-orbiter-uavs-352890/

name: Ukraine
desc: Ukraine domestically produces mini and small drones and has leftover Soviet-made drones still being used for surveillance. Civilians started a crowdfunding campaign to raise money and build a drone for surveillance use.
source: Discovery: http://news.discovery.com/tech/robotics/ukraines-reviving-retro-drones-to-tip-the-battle-scale-140808.htm, Guardian: http://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/jun/29/outgunned-ukrainian-army-crowdfunding-people-drone

name: United Kingdom
desc: The United Kingdom has domestic production of small, MALE, and Watchkeeper drones, based on an imported Hermes 450 drone from Israel, and is the only country to import armed (Reaper) drones from United States.
source: WSJ: http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052970204844504577098583174059746.html, Military Factory: http://www.militaryfactory.com/aircraft/detail.asp?aircraft_id=824, Army Recognition: http://www.army-technology.com/projects/watchkeeper/

name: United States
exports_to: Australia, Burundi, Colombia, Denmark, Egypt, Estonia, France, Germany, Iraq, Italy, Lebanon, Netherlands, New Zealand, Panama, Pakistan, Poland, Romania, South Korea, Uganda, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom
desc: The United States has domestic production of drones and has imported drones from Israel. In 2012, the Pentagon asked Congress for nearly $5 billion for new drone systems. The United States only exports armed drones to the United Kingdom. Participating in NATO's Airborne Ground Surveillance Program which will give NATO five HALE drones by 2017.
source: WSJ: http://online.wsj.com/news/articles/SB10001424127887323764804578314501943739028?mg=reno64-wsj&url=http%3A%2F%2Fonline.wsj.com%2Farticle%2FSB10001424127887323764804578314501943739028.html, http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052970204844504577098583174059746.html, FAS: http://www.fas.org/sgp/crs/natsec/R42136.pdf, Defense Industry Daily: http://www.defenseindustrydaily.com/britain-requests-10-mq-9-reapers-for-over-1b-04536/, NATO: http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/topics_48892.htm

name: Uruguay
desc: Uruguay has domestic production of drones for surveillance and surveying.
source: ASCOA: http://www.as-coa.org/articles/explainer-drones-latin-america

name: Venezuela
desc: Reported domestic production of drones with the help of Iran, Russia, and China and plans to export drones in the near future.
source: Reuters: http://www.reuters.com/article/2012/06/14/us-venezuela-iran-drone-idUSBRE85D14N20120614, JPost: http://www.jpost.com/Iranian-Threat/News/Iran-admits-exporting-drone-tech-to-Venezuela, Global Post: http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/regions/americas/venezuela/120615/venezuela-building-drones-iran-russia-china

name: Vietnam
desc: Reports that mini drones are to be constructed with the help of Russia. Sweden entered into an agreement with Vietnam to provide drones technology and help in producing drones. Domestically built six drones that required engine and propeller parts imported from France and Japan that were approved for civilian and military use. Vietnam is to purchase drones from Belarus. Vietnam has used drones for the police.
source: UPI: http://www.upi.com/Business_News/Security-Industry/2012/03/20/Russia-to-build-mini-uav-drones/UPI-67911332274228/, SUAS News: http://www.suasnews.com/2012/11/19783/vietnam-sweden-to-cooperate-in-unmanned-aircraft-manufacturing/, VOV: http://english.vov.vn/Society/Sweden-helps-Vietnam-manufacture-Drones/250656.vov, APDF: http://apdforum.com/en_GB/article/rmiap/articles/online/features/2013/06/06/vietnam-adds-drones, Washington Times: http://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2014/apr/28/europe-asia-plan-to-spend-big-on-drone-development/?page=all
